data.name: Team Aqua's Cacturne
rules: This Pokémon is both Grass Darkness type.

attacks.name: Dark Bind
attacks.text: You may discard a Darkness Energy card attached to Team Aqua's Cacturne. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Barb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Team Aqua's Crawdaunt
rules: This Pokémon is both Water Darkness type.

attacks.name: Aqua Reverse
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has Team Magma in its name and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Deep Impact
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Team Aqua's Kyogre
rules: This Pokémon is both Water Darkness type.

abilities.name: Power Saver
abilities.text: As long as the number of Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) that has Team Aqua in its name is 3 or less, Team Aqua's Kyogre can't attack.

attacks.name: Aqua Trip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Aqua Smash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Team Aqua's Walrein
rules: This Pokémon is both Water Darkness type.

attacks.name: Power Blow
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Team Aqua's Walrein.

attacks.name: Hydro Reverse
attacks.text: You may return any number of basic Water Energy cards attached to all of your Pokémon to your hand. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy you returned.

data.name: Team Aqua's Manectric
rules: This Pokémon is both Lightning Darkness type.

abilities.name: Power Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move any number of basic Energy cards attached to 1 of your Pokémon with Team Aqua in its name to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Team Aqua's Manectric is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Thunderspark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) that has Energy cards attached to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Team Aqua's Sharpedo
rules: This Pokémon is both Water Darkness type.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Team Aqua's Sharpedo.

attacks.name: Aqua Slash
attacks.text: Team Aqua's Sharpedo can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Team Magma's Aggron
rules: This Pokémon is both Fighting Darkness type.

attacks.name: Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to Team Magma's Aggron. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Land Stream
attacks.text: You may discard any number of basic Energy cards attached to Team Magma's Aggron. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each basic Energy card you discarded.

data.name: Team Magma's Claydol
rules: This Pokémon is both Psychic Darkness type.

abilities.name: Magma Switch
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move an Energy card attached to your Pokémon with Team Magma in its name to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Team Magma's Claydol is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Dark Hand
attacks.text: If you have more cards in your hand than your opponent, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Team Magma's Groudon
rules: This Pokémon is both Fighting Darkness type.

abilities.name: Power Saver
abilities.text: As long as the number of Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) that has Team Magma in its name is 3 or less, Team Magma's Groudon can't attack.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Pulverize
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has at least 2 damage counters on it, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Team Magma's Houndoom
rules: This Pokémon is both Fire Darkness type.

attacks.name: Roasting Heat
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Burned, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Magma Spurt
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards from your deck. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Fire and Fighting basic Energy cards discarded in this way.

data.name: Team Magma's Rhydon
rules: This Pokémon is both Fighting Darkness type.

attacks.name: Magma Jab
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Shoot Down
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has Team Aqua in its name, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon (1 if there is only 1). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Kerzap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage to the Defending Pokémon and discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Raichu.

data.name: Team Magma's Torkoal
rules: This Pokémon is both Fire Darkness type.

attacks.name: Magma Burn
attacks.text: Discard the top card from your opponent's deck, and flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Team Magma's Torkoal.

attacks.name: Hot Air
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Team Magma's Torkoal and your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: Aqua Trance
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Super Hypnoblast
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Poison Reaction
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Double Claw
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Mystic Fang
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Basic Pokémon or Basic Pokémon with Team Aqua in its name and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thick Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Slow-Acting Poison
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Aqua Smash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bite Off
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

abilities.name: Overheat
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Team Magma's Camerupt. Put 2 damage counters on Team Mamga's Camerupt. This power can't be used if Team Magma's Camerupt is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Flame Ball
attacks.text: You may move a Fire Energy card attached to Team Magma's Camerupt to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Second Strike
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has at least 2 damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Land Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy card attached to Team Magma's Rhydon.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Colorless Basic Pokémon or Basic Pokémon with Team Magma in its name and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Team Play
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokémon in play with Team Magma in its name.

rules: This Pokémon is both Grass Darkness type.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Dark Lift
abilities.text: If Team Aqua's Carvanha has any Darkness Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Team Aqua's Carvanha is 0.

attacks.name: Slow-Acting Poison
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Double Pinchers

attacks.name: Dark Poison
attacks.text: Discard a basic Energy card attached to Team Aqua's Corphish or this attack does nothing. The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

abilities.name: Auxiliary Light
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a basic Energy card from your hand to Team Aqua's Lanturn. Put 2 damage counters on Team Aqua's Lanturn. This power can't be used if Team Aqua's Lanturn is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Team Aqua's Electrike.

attacks.name: Aqua Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has Team Magma in its name, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Chaos Crush
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Confused, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Call
attacks.text: Search your deck for Pokémon that has Team Aqua in its name, show up to 3 of them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Target Scorch
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has Team Aqua in its name, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Damage Burn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Knock Over

attacks.name: Clay Curse
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Clay Pulse
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Psymist
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, choose 1 of you opponent's Pokémon and put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pain Amplifier
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon that already has damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Land Sonic
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Call for Help
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Team Magma's Mightyena is your Active Pokémon, you may search your deck for a Pokémon with Team Magma in its name, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Team Magma's Mightyena is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 3 damage counters from Jigglypuff (all if there are less than 3). Jigglypuff is now Asleep.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Team Aqua Schemer
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Discard any 1 Pokémon from your hand. Then draw 3 cards. If you discarded a Pokémon with Team Aqua in its name, draw 4 cards instead.

attacks.name: Darkness Call
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

data.name: Archie
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

Search your deck for a Pokémon with Team Aqua in its name and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as a Basic Pokémon. If it is a Stage 2 Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

data.name: Team Magma Schemer
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Discard any 1 Pokémon from your hand. Then draw 3 cards. If you discarded a Pokémon with Team Magma in its name, draw 4 cards instead.

data.name: Dual Ball
rules: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Strength Charm
rules: Attach Strength Charm to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.

Whenever an attack from the Pokémon that Strength Charm is attached to does damage to the Active Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage. At the end of the turn in which this happens, discard Strength Charm.

data.name: Maxie
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

Search your hand or discard pile for a Pokémon with Team Magma in its name and put it onto your Bench. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as a Basic Pokémon. If it is a Stage 2 Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

data.name: Team Aqua Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon that has Team Aqua in its name, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. If tails, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon that has Team Aqua in its name, show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Team Aqua Belt
rules: Attach Team Aqua Belt to 1 of your Pokémon with Team Aqua in its name that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.

At any time between turns, if the Pokémon Team Aqua Belt is attached to is your Active Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it on that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward, then discard Team Aqua Belt.

data.name: Team Aqua Technical Machine 01
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon that has Team Aqua in its name. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Team Aqua Technical Machine 01.

attacks.name: Miracle
attacks.text: Choose 1 Special Condition. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

data.name: Team Aqua Conspirator
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Basic Pokémon with Team Aqua in its name and basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Team Aqua Hideout
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Each Pokémon that does not have Team Aqua in its name pays Colorless more to retreat.

data.name: Team Magma Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon that has Team Magma in its name, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. If tails, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon that has Team Magma in its name, show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Team Magma Belt
rules: Attach Team Magma Belt to 1 of your Pokémon with Team Magma in its name that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.

At any time between turns, if the Pokémon Team Magma Belt is attached to is your Active Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it on that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward, then discard Team Magma Belt.

data.name: Team Magma Conspirator
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Basic Pokémon with Team Magma in its name and basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Team Magma Hideout
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Whenever any player plays a Basic Pokémon that doesn't have Team Magma in its name from his or her hand, that player puts 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

data.name: Warp Point
rules: Your opponent switches 1 of his or her Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. You switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

data.name: Team Magma Technical Machine 01
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon that has Team Magma in its name. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Team Magma Technical Machine 01.

attacks.name: Crushing Magma
attacks.text: Choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon and put that card at the bottom of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Aqua Energy
rules: Aqua Energy can be attached only to a Pokémon with Team Aqua in its name. Aqua Energy provides Water and Darkness Energy but provides 2 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play and has no other effect than providing Energy.) At the end of your turn, discard Aqua Energy.

data.name: Magma Energy
rules: Magma Energy can be attached only to a Pokémon with Team Magma in its name. Magma Energy provides Fighting and /or Darkness Energy but provides 2 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play and has no other effect than providing Energy.) At the end of your turn, discard Magma Energy.

data.name: Double Rainbow Energy
rules: Double Rainbow Energy can be attached only to an Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex). While in play, Double Rainbow Energy provides every type of Energy but provides 2 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy when not in play and has no effect other than providing Energy.) Damage done to your opponent's Pokémon by the Pokémon Double Rainbow Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). When the Pokémon Double Rainbow Energy is attached to is no longer an Evolved Pokémon, discard Double Rainbow Energy.

data.name: Blaziken ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blaze Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 30 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Volcanic Ash
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Blaziken ex and then choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Cradily ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Primal Vibes
abilities.text: As long as Cradily ex is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play a Pokémon from his or her hand to evolve his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Eerie Light
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Acidic Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Burned.

data.name: Entei ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Bright Flame
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Entei ex.

data.name: Raikou ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Lightning Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Raikou ex does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Sceptile ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Green Heal
attacks.text: Remove 4 damage counters from each of your Pokémon that has Grass Energy attached. If that Pokémon has less than 4 damage counters, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Poison Ring
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: Sceptile ex can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

data.name: Suicune ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Flip
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. You may move an Energy card attached to that Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Reverse Stream
attacks.text: You may return all basic Energy cards attached to Suicune ex to your hand. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each basic Energy card you returned.

data.name: Swampert ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hyper Pump
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each basic Energy attached to Swampert ex but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 80 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Crushing Wave
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. After doing damage, flip a coin. If heads, your opponent discards an Energy card, if any, attached to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies or any other effects on that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.
